data.event: Situated to the north east of Crosby, it is a residential area of semi-detached and detached housing which dates mainly from the 1930s.

event.title: 2001 Census the population of the village and civil parish was recorded

data.event: At the 2001 Census the population of the village and civil parish was recorded as 2,262, falling to 2,139 at the Census 2011.

event.title: 1086, the settlement of Torentún is recorded

data.event: During the compilation of the Domesday Book in 1086, the settlement of Torentún is recorded, along with the settlement of Homer Green, which far outdates any claim that Ince Blundell is the oldest village in Sefton.

event.title: became part the municipal borough of Crosby in 1937

data.event: The district subsequently became part the municipal borough of Crosby in 1937.

event.title: was still served by West Lancashire Council until the formation of the Metropolitan Borough of Sefton on 1 April 1974

data.event: Thornton was still served by West Lancashire Council until the formation of the Metropolitan Borough of Sefton on 1 April 1974.
